results.title: Safety record
results.creator_credit: Roland D. Blake, Glenn Griffin and Sarra
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personal Side of Safety”.
Quotes company records to prove to workers that safety is successful, modern, and popular, and that safety is accomplished by the individual.

results.title: Get a grip on yourself
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personal Side of Safety”.
Points out that the control of emotion is necessary in order to be safe on the job and avoid serious accidents. Explains how to recognize emotions and what causes them, and suggests how to control emotions

results.title: Decide to be safe
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personal Side of Safety”.
Shows that safety comes with decision. Points out that the worker must decide to be safe and build up a reserve of safety knowledge on what to do in any situation.

results.title: The Orchard, timber yard, Oakbank farm
results.creator_credit: James Mann, Chris O'Rourke and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “People Who Help Us”.
This program looks at three different work environments, an apple orchard a timber yard and a children’s animal farm. We see the people who work there, find out what each job entails and the process used to accomplish the various tasks involved.

results.title: The Firefighter, Police helicopter, Police officer
results.creator_credit: James Mann, Chris O'Rourke and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “People Who Help Us”.
Shows the work done by a firefighter, by policemen who man the police helicopter and the work of a various police officers from senior sargents to motor cycle police. The duties and responsibilities of each profession and the necessary equipment and supplies required by each person in order to get the job done.

results.title: At the supermarket
results.creator_credit: David Hughes and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “People Who Help Us”.
Non-narrated. Shows us some of the people who help run a supermarket. Apart from the familiar helpers such as checkout cashiers, and sales assistants we also see people who prepare meat and vegetables for sale, those who order and take delivery of stock and night fillers.

results.title: The Nurse; the vet; the ambulance
results.creator_credit: James Mann, Chris O'Rourke and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “People Who Help Us”.
A composite tape showing three short programs which give profiles of occupations which help to keep us safe and healthy. On this tape a nurse, a vet and an ambulance driver give insights into their daily duties.

group_works.title: Eskimo summer
group_works.creator_credit: Robert Young, Quentin Brown, Michael McKennirey, Richard Robinson and National Film Board of Canada

group_works.title: Eskimo winter
group_works.creator_credit: Richard Robinson, George Pearson, Michael McKennirey, Brian Branston, British Broadcasting Corporation and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Eskimo summer
results.creator_credit: Robert Young, Quentin Brown, Michael McKennirey, Richard Robinson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “People of the Seal”.
Eskimo Summer is compiled from some of the most vivid footage ever filmed of the life of the Netsilik Inuit in the Pelly Bay region of the Canadian Arctic. Together, the two films provide insight and understanding of a culture now almost vanished, as they show the incredible resourcefulness of the Netsilik (People of the Seal) who have adapted to one of the world’s harshest environments. Part 1: Eskimo Summer shows how Inuit families prepare for winter by hunting seal, birds and caribou and by fishing for Arctic Char during the exentded hours of daylight. (Award: Salerno)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Young, Quentin Brown, Michael McKennirey, Richard Robinson and National Film Board of Canada
